lead_paragraph: The master probably had osteoarthritis, but his commitment to art may have kept his hands functional until his death in 1564, according to doctors.

headline.print_headline: Physiology: Portraits of an Aging, Arthritic Michelangelo
headline.main: Portraits of an Older Michelangelo Indicate He Had Arthritic Hands

snippet: The master probably had osteoarthritis, but his commitment to art may have kept his hands functional until his death in 1564, according to doctors.
abstract: Study in The Journal of the Royal Society of Medicine concludes artist Michelangeolo may have been suffering from osteoarthritis from ages 60 to 65, as revealed by portraits of artist, but continuous work and use of his hands may have kept them functional.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Journal of the Royal Society of Medicine
